title: Scope 1 (Trust & Safety): Agency-preserving, non-inferential copy updates

requirements.summary: Audit and update user-facing copy to avoid implied mood inference; frame insights as patterns based on user-selected moods/posts.
acceptanceCriteria: No UI text claims or implies the system can tell how a user feels without the user explicitly selecting a mood (avoid phrases like “we know”, “you felt”, “your circle feels”, “your mood indicates distress”).
Where the app summarizes history, the text explicitly references “your selected moods”, “your entries”, “your posts”, or equivalent agency-preserving phrasing.
All updated strings are in English.

file_operations.description: Update user-facing copy (page title, section prompts, note placeholder, button/loading text) to avoid implying the app knows how the user feels; emphasize the user choosing a mood and optionally adding context.
Revise reminder title/description/button label to invite a user-chosen check-in (selected mood) without implying the app is checking or assessing feelings.
Adjust analyzer card subtitle and section headings to describe patterns from the user’s selected moods/entries (not inferred emotional state), and remove clinical-sounding UI labels.
Audit generated guidance/disclaimer strings to remove implied emotional inference and clinical/diagnostic framing; ensure output text consistently references selected moods/entries.
Audit and update generated circle summary templates so they reference posting trends (based on posts/moods shared) and never claim to know how the circle feels.
Update rotating login hero/card copy to preserve agency (what you choose to share / moods you select) and remove any language implying the app interprets feelings.
Update login panel static UI text (feature descriptions, primary button label, consent line if needed) to align with non-inferential, agency-preserving framing while keeping a calm tone.
Refine foundation promise/boundary copy, if needed, to explicitly describe patterns as derived from user check-ins/posts and avoid any wording that could imply inference.

requirements.summary: Update Mood Analyzer UI and generated guidance to be agency-preserving, trend/distribution-focused, and non-clinical.
acceptanceCriteria: In frontend/src/components/profile/MoodAnalyzerCard.tsx, the card subtitle and section labels do not describe “emotional patterns” as something the system determines; they are framed as analysis of the user’s selections/entries.

In frontend/src/utils/moodAnalysis.ts, guidance text uses wording like “Based on your selected moods/entries…” and avoids “you felt…”, “emotional well-being”, “distress”, “clinical consideration”, or diagnosis-like language.
If there are 0 entries, the empty-state guidance does not instruct users to “share your feelings”; it invites them to select moods/check in to see patterns.

file_operations.description: Revise analyzer subtitle ('Private analysis of your emotional patterns') and section labels (e.g., 'Concern Level', 'Analysis & Guidance') to explicitly refer to 'selected moods'/'entries' and remove clinical/diagnostic framing from labels/badges.

Rewrite generateGuidance() output to be distribution/trend-based and agency-preserving (e.g., 'Based on your selected moods...'); remove diagnosis-like headings and phrases ('clinical consideration', 'distress', 'recommendation'); update empty-state text to invite check-ins/selected moods rather than 'share your feelings'; adjust disclaimer language to remain non-clinical and non-diagnostic.

requirements.summary: Ensure mood picker and check-in flow remain fully user-chosen with no defaults, auto-suggestions, or recommendation-like copy.
acceptanceCriteria: In frontend/src/components/status/MoodPicker.tsx and frontend/src/pages/ComposeStatusPage.tsx, no mood is auto-selected and no “suggested mood” UI is introduced.
Compose page copy (e.g., title, description, note placeholder) is updated to reflect choosing/sharing what the user wants (not what the app thinks they feel).
Mood reminder card text is updated to avoid implying the app is checking how the user feels; it invites the user to choose a mood/check in.

file_operations.description: Confirm and preserve fully user-chosen selection behavior (keep selectedMood nullable, no default selection); adjust any surrounding picker microcopy (e.g., search placeholder) if it implies suggestion/recommendation.

Update compose page headings, prompts, and textarea placeholder to emphasize user choice (select a mood you want to share; add an optional note you choose) and avoid 'How are you feeling' inference-style language; ensure no default mood is set.
Update reminder copy to invite a user-led check-in (choose a mood) rather than implying the app is checking on or assessing the user’s feelings.

requirements.summary: Reframe Circle Energy summaries as patterns observed in posts from the last week (no 'your circle feels' phrasing).
acceptanceCriteria: In frontend/src/utils/circleEnergy.ts, generated summaries do not use “feels” language implying emotional inference; they reference posting trends (e.g., “Posts this week leaned calm/mixed…”).
A quick scan of the returned summary templates confirms no diagnostic/clinical language is introduced.

file_operations.description: Replace summary templates that say 'Your circle feels...' / 'Things feel...' with trend-based, evidence-referencing phrasing (e.g., 'Posts this week leaned calm/mixed...' or 'This week’s posts had a calm/steady mix...'); keep the existing non-clinical banned-terms safety check aligned with the new templates.
If needed, adjust the displayed label/intro around the summary so it clarifies the text reflects patterns in recent posts (without adding new routes or pages).

requirements.summary: Update login/onboarding/product copy to emphasize user choice and private sharing of selected moods while keeping the calm tone.
acceptanceCriteria: In frontend/src/constants/loginCopy.ts, rotating hero/card copy no longer says “share your feelings” in a way that could imply the app is interpreting them; it references sharing what you choose / the moods you select.
Foundation copy remains consistent with Scope 1: it should describe noticing patterns from check-ins without implying inference.

file_operations.description: Rewrite heroSubtexts and cardSubheadings to remove 'share your feelings' and any implication the app 'holds/understands' feelings; replace with calm, agency-forward phrasing focused on chosen check-ins and selected moods.

Update login CTA/button text and any supporting copy that implies emotional inference (e.g., 'safe space to share your feelings') to align with user choice and selected moods; keep tone calm and consistent with updated constants.
Ensure foundation promise/boundary explicitly describes patterns as derived from user check-ins/posts and avoids any wording that implies the app detects or infers emotions.
